skill.author: Chachamaru127

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing no executable code. It provides guidelines for build verification, error recovery, and code review processes with strong quality guardrails that prevent test tampering and enforce proper development practices.

content.user_title: Verify Builds and Fix Errors Automatically
content.value_statement: Stop wasting time on failed builds and broken tests. This skill automatically verifies your code, recovers from errors, and applies review fixes while preventing harmful shortcuts like test skipping.
actual_capabilities: Automatically runs builds and tests after code changes
Recovers from common build errors with pattern matching
Applies approved review fixes like removing unused imports
Prevents test tampering (no skipping or assertion removal)
Aggregates multiple review types into unified reports
limitations: Cannot fix complex architectural issues automatically
Requires user approval for non-trivial changes
Limited to 3 retry attempts for error recovery

use_cases.title: Post-Implementation Verification
use_cases.description: Automatically verify builds and tests pass after implementing new features or fixes.

use_cases.title: Apply Review Feedback
use_cases.description: Quickly apply approved automated fixes from code reviews like formatting and unused code removal.

use_cases.title: CI Pipeline Recovery
use_cases.description: Automatically recover from common CI failures without manual intervention.

prompt_templates.title: Verify Build
prompt_templates.prompt: I just finished implementing the new feature. Can you verify that the build passes and all tests are working correctly?

prompt_templates.title: Fix Build Errors
prompt_templates.prompt: The build is failing with TypeScript errors. Can you help fix these compilation issues?

prompt_templates.title: Apply Review Fixes
prompt_templates.prompt: The code review found several issues. Can you apply the automated fixes for unused imports and formatting?

prompt_templates.title: Error Recovery
prompt_templates.prompt: The tests are failing with assertion errors. Try to automatically fix the issues or escalate if needed.

output_examples.input: Verify that my recent changes build successfully
output: Ready to proceed to next step.

best_practices: Always verify builds after making changes before submitting PRs
Use the skill's quality guardrails to prevent test tampering
Review the diff before applying automated fixes
anti_patterns: Don't skip tests or remove assertions to make builds pass
Avoid disabling lint rules instead of fixing code issues
Never use continue-on-error to bypass CI checks

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Node.js/JavaScript, Python, Rust, and Go projects are supported with language-specific build commands.

faq.question: What happens if automatic fixes fail?
faq.answer: The skill will retry up to 3 times, then escalate with detailed error information and recommended actions.

faq.question: Can it fix all types of errors?
faq.answer: No, it handles common patterns like missing modules, type errors, and formatting issues but not complex architectural problems.

faq.question: Is my code safe from harmful changes?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill has strict guardrails preventing test tampering and requires approval for non-trivial changes.

faq.question: How does it integrate with my existing CI?
faq.answer: It runs the same commands as your CI (npm test, pytest, etc.) ensuring consistency between local and CI environments.

faq.question: Can I use it with Claude Code only?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with Claude Code, Claude, and Codex across different AI coding platforms.
